nl.knaw.dans.rs.aggregator.xml

Class RsBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.knaw.dans.rs.aggregator.xml.RsBuilder

  • public class RsBuilder
extends Object
    Utility class for building RsRoot class hierarchies. The concrete RsRoot is either a Urlset or a Sitemapindex.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RsBuilder(ResourceSyncContext rsContext)
      Constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • build

        public Optional<RsRoot> build()
                       throws JAXBException
        Build a class hierarchy from the input previously given with one of set-methods.

        Example usage:

           RsBuilder rsBuilder = new RsBuilder(new ResourceSyncContext());
   Optional<RsRoot> maybeRoot = rsBuilder.setInputStream(inStream).build();

        We can test what concrete class was unmarshalled by obtaining the QName:

           Optional<QName> maybeQName = rsBuilder.getQName();

        Or directly test one of two possibilities:

           Optional<Sitemapindex> maybeSitemapindex = rsBuilder.getSitemapindex();
   Optional<Urlset> maybeUrlset = rsBuilder.getUrlset();
        Returns:
        Optional of RsRoot
        Throws:
        JAXBException - for invalid input

      • getQName

        public Optional<QName> getQName()
        Get an optional of the QName of the latest unmarshalled document. Either null, Sitemapindex.QNAME or Urlset.QNAME.
        Returns:
        optional of QName of latest unmarshalled document

      • getUrlset

        public Optional<Urlset> getUrlset()
        Get an optional Urlset of the latest unmarshalled document. Either null, or Urlset.
        Returns:
        optional of Urlset

      • getSitemapindex

        public Optional<Sitemapindex> getSitemapindex()
        Get an optional Sitemapindex of the latest unmarshalled document. Either null, or Sitemapindex.
        Returns:
        optional of Sitemapindex

      • toXml

        public String toXml(RsRoot rsRoot,
                    boolean formattedOutput)
             throws JAXBException
        Marshal a class hierarchy to its xml-representation.
        Parameters:
        rsRoot - the root class of the class hierarchy to marshal
        formattedOutput - format the output as pretty xml
        Returns:
        xml representation as String
        Throws:
        JAXBException - for invalid input
